Ema Abir is a Doctorate in Clinical Psychology Trainee (2027). Her project is focused on cognitive inhibition and flexibility as moderators of the relationship between depression and problem gambling. Her work employs a neuroeconomic approach, using functional near-infrared spectroscopy to examine neural correlates of gambling decisions.
